intro: Sphacele subhastata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sphacele, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sphacele subhastata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
